content: legs piece one make 4 start in green 1 9fsc or sc10 and 9sc starting in 2nd chain from hook 2 - 27 ch1 and turn single_crochet across at the end of the last row ccb 28 - 33 ch1 and turn single_crochet across i recommend placing stitch markers at 12 row then 9 row these are the corners legs piece two make 4 start in green 1 9fsc or sc10 and 9sc starting in 2nd chain from hook 2 - 33 ch1 and turn single_crochet across i recommend placing stitch markers at 12 row then 9 row these are the corners leave a long tail for sewing again line up the corresponding letters and sew together assembly sew the head to the body using the open end of the body line it up in the middle of the bottom of the head with about two stitches either side and about 5 row front and back creeper pattern ©sharkythreads 2024 for attaching the feet find the centre of the front or back of the body and mark it with a stitch marker like the image to the left line up the top edge of the foot with the body using the stitch marker as a marker for where the corner of the foot goes once the feet are attached it should look like the image below tips of course you can use your own methods the following are only guidelines if you re looking to try something new switching colours this colour change is done in the round but can still apply when crocheting flat especially in the creeper s face before you begin the last stitch before the colour change you should have one loop on your hook the stitch here is the last for a row in the round using slip stitch and chain one creeper pattern ©sharkythreads 2024 yarn over and pull through as usual but don t finish the stitch instead attach your new colour and use that to complete the stitch your next stitch will be in the new colour as you can see from this bee i was making the stripe is clean thank you so much for using my pattern feel free to tag me in photos of what you create from my patterns on instagram @sharkythreads
